findings: • Systems (6.03) is lowest dimension - 67.5% report organization challenges
• Active Learning (45%) indicates passive revision strategies dominating
• Middle band students (â‰ˆ24-30) show engagement patterns ready for development
actions: • Priority coaching with 24-30 middle band students (5-7 min) - focus on Systems dimension imbalances
• 45-min team meeting: use 100 Statements to identify 3-5 priority behaviors for consistent reinforcement
• Deliver Weekly Planner (SY26) in next tutorial - addresses time management foundations
quick_wins.activities:
• Weekly Planner (SY26) - Students audit schedules and create balanced weekly plans addressing time management issues [Portal: Activities > Systems > SY26]
  • 1% Planning (SY24) - Daily 7-minute planning ritual for improved focus and task clarity [Portal: Activities > Systems > SY24]
quick_wins.behaviors:
• "I sometimes plan my week in advance, giving myself plenty of time to work on tasks"
  • "I look ahead to next week, checking what needs doing so that even when lots of deadlines come at once, I work out how to finish and submit everything"
  • "I make mini-lists of tasks I have to do at the start of particular periods - like on a Monday, or over a weekend - and think about how to prioritise them"
questions: • How do you currently manage your time and commitments?
• What makes it difficult to stay organized?
• When you say you're 'on top of things' - what does that actually look like?
• Do you plan your week, or just react to what comes?

findings: • Sustained Systems development requires habit formation over quick fixes
• Middle band students (coasting at 5.5-6.5) have highest potential for measurable growth
• Active Learning strategies need explicit teaching - 45% shows knowledge gap
actions: • Implement 6-week activity cycle: one activity per fortnight in tutorial time
• Track middle band cohort specifically - monitor for 0.4-0.6 point gains by Cycle 2
• Monthly 5-min check-ins with coached students: "How's your goal going?"
medium_term.activities:
• Weeks 1-2: 1% Planning (SY24) - Builds daily planning habit from Weekly Planner foundation [Portal]
  • Weeks 3-4: High & Low Utility (PR18) - Teaches difference between effective and ineffective study techniques [Portal]
  • Weeks 5-6: Test Yourself (PR232) - Active recall practice using the testing effect [Portal]
  • Weeks 7-8: Pending, Doing, Done (SY7) - Visual task management consolidating organization skills [Portal]
medium_term.behaviors:
• "I can summarise and reshape information so it feels like mine"
  • "I will find opportunities to test myself on the knowledge I have gained"
  • "I often list the things I have to do and figure out which order I need to do things"
questions: • Which activity from the last fortnight did you actually try?
• What's getting in the way of making this a habit?
• How has your approach to [Systems/Practice] changed since we last spoke?

findings: • Coaching culture requires consistent tutor capacity building across academic year
• Behavioral language adoption enables specific, observable feedback replacing vague praise
actions: • Embed VESPA behavioral language in all written feedback and reports to parents
• Build VESPA Champions program from high-performing students to mentor middle band peers
• Establish data review cycle: Cycle 2 (Jan) and Cycle 3 (Jun) analysis inform strategic pivots
long_term.timeline:
• Term 1 (Sep-Dec): Quick Wins implementation, Medium Term activities launch, Cycle 2 assessment (December)
  • Term 2 (Jan-Mar): Cycle 2 data analysis, adjust interventions based on what worked, VESPA Champions program launch
  • Term 3 (Apr-Jul): Mock exam debrief using VESPA lens, Cycle 3 assessment (June), year-end review and 2026/27 planning
success_indicators: • Middle band student average moves to 6.8+ (from 5.5-6.5 range)
• 80%+ of students have documented goals via coaching conversations
